intro: Scleria stipularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. Scleria stipularis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, or along water bodies. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small aquatic organisms.
